name: The Golden Bowl
tagline: A man marries an heiress for her money even though he is actually in love with her friend.

name: Melancholia
tagline: Two sisters find their already strained relationship challenged as a mysterious new planet threatens to collide with Earth.

name: Hedwig and the Angry Inch
tagline: A transexual punk rock girl from East Berlin tours the US with her rock band as she tells her life story and follows the ex-boyfriend/bandmate who stole her songs.

name: G
tagline: "G" is a Gatsbyesque love story set against Hip-Hop's invasion of the Hamptons.

name: From Prada to Nada
tagline: A Latina spin on Jane Austen's "Sense and Sensibility," where two spoiled sisters who have been left penniless after their father's sudden death are forced to move in with their estranged aunt in East Los Angeles.

name: Albert Nobbs
tagline: Albert Nobbs struggles to survive in late 19th century Ireland, where women aren't encouraged to be independent. Posing as a man, so she can work as a butler in Dublin's most posh hotel, Albert meets a handsome painter and looks to escape the lie she has been living.

name: Speedway
tagline: Poor bookkeeping saddles stock car driver Steve Grayson with a huge bill for back taxes which hampers his ability to continue racing competitively.

name: Top Hat
tagline: An American dancer comes to Britain and falls for a model whom he initially annoyed, but she mistakes him for his goofy producer.

name: The Jazz Singer
tagline: The son of a Jewish Cantor must defy his father in order to pursue his dream of becoming a jazz singer.

name: Forbidden Planet
tagline: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has.

name: The Birth of a Nation
tagline: The Civil War divides friends and destroys families, but that's nothing compared to the anarchy in the black-ruled South after the war.

name: Sign 'o' the Times
tagline: A concert film with theatrical staging, featuring live performances by Prince and his band.

name: Macumba Love
tagline: A writer who specializes in exposing fake witchcraft journeys to Brazil to investigate a voodoo cult.

name: Over the Hill to the Poorhouse
tagline: The mother of a large family is abandoned by her children and faces consignment to the poorhouse. But one of her offspring, the one no one had faith in, returns to rescue her.

name: Aloma of the South Seas
tagline: Young South Seas native boy is sent to the U.S. for his education, returns to his island after his father dies to try to stop a revolution.

name: The Last Days of Disco
tagline: Story of two female Manhattan book editors fresh out of college, both finding love and themselves while frequenting the local disco.

name: Fright Night Part 2
tagline: Charlie Brewster and Peter Vincent from the original Fright Night must face more vampires out for revenge.

name: Martha Marcy May Marlene
tagline: Haunted by painful memories and increasing paranoia, a damaged woman struggles to re-assimilate with her family after fleeing an abusive cult.

name: Miss Potter
tagline: The story of Beatrix Potter, the author of the beloved and best-selling children's book, "The Tale of Peter Rabbit", and her struggle for love, happiness and success.

name: Homicide
tagline: A Jewish homicide detective investigates a seemingly minor murder and falls in with a Zionist group as a result.

name: In a World...
tagline: An underachieving voice coach finds herself competing in the movie trailer voice-over profession against her arrogant father and his protégé.

name: Man on Wire
tagline: A look at tightrope walker Philippe Petit's daring, but illegal, high-wire routine performed between New York City's World Trade Center's twin towers in 1974, what some consider, "the artistic crime of the century."

name: The Pirate
tagline: A girl is engaged to the local richman, but meanwhile she has dreams about the legendary pirate Macoco. A traveling singer falls in love with her and to impress her he poses as the pirate.

name: 976-EVIL
tagline: People who dial 976-EVIL receive supernatural powers and turn into satanic killers.

name: Gracie
tagline: A teenager faces an uphill battle when she fights to give women the opportunity to play competitive soccer.

name: Metropolitan
tagline: A group of young upper-class Manhattanites are blithely passing through the gala debutante season, when an unusual outsider joins them and stirs them up.

name: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
tagline: A documentary on the life and career of Joan Rivers, made as the comedienne turns 75 years old.

name: Choke
tagline: A sex-addicted con-man pays for his mother's hospital bills by playing on the sympathies of those who rescue him from choking to death.

name: This Is My Life
tagline: A stand-up comic (Julie Kavner) neglects her two daughters in the midst of her newfound fame.

name: Veer-Zaara
tagline: The story of the love between Veer Pratap Singh, an Indian, and Zaara Hayaat Khan, a Pakistani...a love so great it knows no boundaries...

name: Tsotsi

production.name: The UK Film & TV Production Company PLC
Industrial Development Corporation of South Africa
The National Film and Video Foundation of SA

tagline: Six days in the violent life of a young Johannesburg gang leader.

name: Cradle Will Rock
tagline: A true story of politics and art in the 1930s USA, centered around a leftist musical drama and attempts to stop its production.

name: Waiting for Guffman
tagline: An aspiring director and the marginally talented amateur cast of a hokey small-town Missouri musical production go overboard when they learn that someone from Broadway will be in attendance.

name: Waking Life
tagline: A man shuffles through a dream meeting various people and discussing the meanings and purposes of the universe.

name: Tadpole
tagline: Coming-of-age story about a 15-year-old boy, Oscar, who falls in love with his stepmother, Eve.

name: Shallow Grave
tagline: Three friends discover their new flatmate dead but loaded with cash.

name: No Man's Land
tagline: A rookie cop goes undercover and infiltrates a car thief ring.

name: The Hudsucker Proxy
tagline: A naive business graduate is installed as president of a manufacturing company as part of a stock scam.

name: Home Run
tagline: A pro ball player with a substance abuse problem is forced into rehab in his hometown, finding new hope when he gets honest about his checkered past, and takes on coaching duties for a misfit Little League team.

name: In the Company of Men
tagline: Two business executives--one an avowed misogynist, the other recently emotionally wounded by his love interest--set out to exact revenge on the female gender by seeking out the most innocent, uncorrupted girl they can find and ruining her life.

name: Things We Lost in the Fire

production.name: Province of British Columbia Production Services Tax Credit

tagline: A recent widow invites her husband's troubled best friend to live with her and her two children. As he gradually turns his life around, he helps the family cope and confront their loss.

name: eXistenZ
tagline: A game designer on the run from assassins must play her latest virtual reality creation with a marketing trainee to determine if the game has been damaged.

name: The Great Beauty
tagline: Jep Gambardella has seduced his way through the lavish nightlife of Rome for decades, but after his 65th birthday and a shock from the past, Jep looks past the nightclubs and parties to find a timeless landscape of absurd, exquisite beauty.

name: Running on Empty
tagline: The eldest son of a fugitive family comes of age and wants to live a life of his own.

name: Filly Brown
tagline: A promising hip-hop rhymer from Los Angeles finds herself in a gray area when a record producer offers her a compromising shot at stardom.

name: Clifford's Really Big Movie
tagline: Worried that he costs too much to feed, Clifford runs away to join a carnival act and help win a lifetime supply of Tummy Yummies.

name: Monsieur Ibrahim
tagline: In Paris, a Turkish shop owner befriends a Jewish boy in his mid-teens.

name: Newsies
tagline: A musical based on the New York City newsboy strike of 1899. When young newspaper sellers are exploited beyond reason by their bosses they set out to enact change and are met by the ruthlessness of big business.

name: Reservoir Dogs
tagline: After a simple jewelery heist goes terribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

name: Return to the Blue Lagoon
tagline: In this sequel to the 1980 classic, two children are stranded on a beautiful island in the South Pacific. With no adults to guide them, the two make a simple life together and eventually become tanned teenagers in love.

name: Barfi!
tagline: Three young people learn that love can neither be defined nor contained by society's norms of normal and abnormal.

name: La mujer de mi hermano
tagline: Unable to get intimate with her husband of 10 years, a woman embarks on a steamy affair with his brother.

name: Kissin' Cousins
tagline: An Army officer returns to the Smoky Mountains tries to convince his kinfolk to allow the Army to build a missile site on their land. Once he gets there, he discovers he has a lookalike cousin.

name: California Casanova
tagline: Stagehand at a nightclub falls for one of the performers. He wins her heart after taking lessons on suavity from a gigolo "count".

name: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
tagline: A British writer struggles to fit in at a high-profile magazine in New York. Based on Toby Young's memoir "How to Lose Friends & Alienate People".

name: Deadtime Stories
tagline: A babysitting uncle tells his charges three horror stories--about a killer witch, Little Red Riding Hood and a werewolf, and a story about "Goldi Lox" and the three bears.

name: My Architect
tagline: Director Nathaniel Kahn searches to understand his father, noted architect Louis Kahn, who died bankrupt and alone in 1974.

name: Happiness
tagline: The lives of many individuals connected by the desire for happiness, often from sources usually considered dark or evil.

name: Comedian
tagline: A look at the work of two stand-up comics, Jerry Seinfeld and a lesser-known newcomer, detailing the effort and frustration behind putting together a successful act and career while living a life on the road.

name: Desperate Hours
tagline: An escaped con on the run from the law moves into a married couple's home and takes over their lives.

name: Shadows and Fog
tagline: With a serial strangler on the loose, a bookkeeper wanders around town searching for the vigilante group intent on catching the killer.

name: In the Mood for Love
tagline: A man and a woman move in to neighboring Hong Kong apartments and form a bond when they both suspect their spouses of extramarital activities.

name: Walk on Water
tagline: Following the suicide of his wife, an Israeli intelligence agent is assigned to befriend the grandchildren of a Nazi war criminal.

name: Everything Must Go
tagline: When an alcoholic relapses, causing him to lose his wife and his job, he holds a yard sale on his front lawn in an attempt to start over. A new neighbor might be the key to his return to form.

name: Chéri
tagline: The son of a courtesan retreats into a fantasy world after being forced to end his relationship with the older woman who educated him in the ways of love.
